image.altText: NT Chief Minister Natasha Fyles,  in a bright pink blazer, standing inside a room and looking at a nearby lectern.

props.synopsis: Independent MLA Mark Turner has referred two matters relating to Natasha Fyles and her office to the Northern Territory Independent Commissioner Against Corruption.

title.children: NT chief minister referred to ICAC over political adviser's gas lobbying ties

image.altText: An out-of-focus photo of school children walking across a bridge from street view.

props.synopsis: A Sydney primary school teacher under investigation for historical child sex abuse allegations is removed from classroom duties after questions are raised by ABC Investigations.

title.children: Sydney school teacher accused of sex abuse not removed from classrooms for 10 years

image.altText: Woman wearing university graduation hat hold certificate and smiles

props.synopsis: Four Flinders University students have graduated at a ceremony in Darwin, with hopes more will follow.

title.children: First cohort of locally trained paramedics graduate in the NT amid workforce shortage

image.altText: A close up shot of Anthony Albanese from below.

props.synopsis: The leaders released a joint statement saying "this cannot be one-sided" and condemning both the October 7 Hamas attacks and the humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

title.children: Albanese joins NZ and Canadian leaders in calling for 'sustainable ceasefire' in Gaza

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Biden says Israel 'starting to lose' international support

image.altText: A composite image of Benjamin Netanyahu and Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: In an increasingly troubled world, there are two men who have a clear incentive to keep their wars going – Benjamin Netanyahu and Vladimir Putin, writes John Lyons.

title.children: Two wars, two leaders, one common thread: What Gaza and Ukraine have in common

image.altText: Pink skies in FNQ.

props.synopsis: Drenching rain and increasing winds have begun in Far North Queensland with Tropical Cyclone Jasper now expected to cross the coast between Cooktown and Port Douglas. Follow live.

title.children: Authorities warn of destructive winds and dangerous flash flooding as Tropical Cyclone Jasper moves towards coast

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: There were eerie skies overnight ahead of Jasper's crossing today
Tropical Cyclone Jasper is likely to cross the Queensland coast this afternoon

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of houses in Shell Cove, Wollongong's south.

props.synopsis: Our severe housing problems will only be fixed if policymakers commit to solving them, writes Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: It will take years to fix Australia's housing problems. But how long do you have?

image.altText: A man sits with two children on his knee outside a wooden cabin.

props.synopsis: Australia could make a world-first decision to ban engineered stone due to the "unacceptable risk to workers", but it's too late for hundreds of people living with silicosis.

title.children: Engineered stone ban on the table, as workers and businesses weigh up the cost

image.altText: A shell in the sky with smoke that appears to be white phosphorus.

props.synopsis: Israel denies using white phosphorus munitions illegally, but the US says it will be seeking more information after fresh reports emerged linking its use to an attack that injured at least nine civilians. This is what we know.

title.children: 'Nasty weapon of war': What we know about Israel's white phosphorus bombs

image.altText: mountains shrouded in storm clouds

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Jasper could bring large swells, storms and "life-threatening floodwaters" to Far North Queensland.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Jasper to hit land today as Far North Queensland braces for impact

image.altText: Judas goat in Murray Sunset National Park

props.synopsis: From just six levies in 1960, there are now more than 200 across Australian industry, as the more palatable form of taxation spreads without any over-arching policy.

title.children: A levy on goat carcasses raised $26 last year. It's just one of a 'grab-bag' of micro-taxes spreading through Australian industry

image.altText: Two men and a woman in suits stand behind podiums in front of a doorway into Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The federal government will hand down its mid-year budget update today, offering fresh insight into how it plans to navigate cost-of-living pressures and a mounting debt bill.

title.children: Today's mid-year budget update will see modest savings but long-term challenges remain

image.altText: An aerial view looking down at a solar panel farm next to a sand mine with a dozer operating

props.synopsis: You might have heard that mining metals needed for the renewable energy transition could harm the environment, so what's actually happening?

title.children: Solar panels, wind turbines and electric cars all come at the cost of toxic mining waste. So how are we managing this?

image.altText: Pink and green visualisation of covid-19

props.synopsis: Australia recorded 43,899 cases of COVID-19 in November, up from 27,903 in October. Here's the latest on what to do if you test positive.

title.children: Is Australia facing another COVID-19 Christmas peak? Here's what to do if you're feeling unwell

image.altText: The sun sets over Kakadu National Park.

props.synopsis: The High Court will this week hear the final appeal from custodians who want to prosecute the Commonwealth over illegal construction work at a sacred site within Kakadu National Park. What can be expected over the next two days?

title.children: From Kakadu to Australia's High Court: Custodians' final appeal over impact to sacred site

image.altText: Nuns

props.synopsis: Eight months after their $50 million class action settlement was finalised with the Commonwealth, descendants of the Northern Territory's Stolen Generations are still waiting to receive compensation.

title.children: A Stolen Generations class action settled eight months ago. Descendants are yet to see a cent

image.altText: Cameron Dick and Steven Miles walking and smiling

props.synopsis: The departure of Annastacia Palaszczuk signals a changing of the parliamentary guard in the state's Labor party.

title.children: Queensland has a new premier. Will it be enough to change Labor’s fortunes ahead of the election?

image.altText: A photo of a boy with blonde hair smiling at the camera is layered over a photo of a historic school building.

props.synopsis: Ethan says he is "haunted" by the abuse he alleges he suffered at the hands of three different men. He hopes his story inspires other victims to come forward, and a more compassionate approach to civil cases.

title.children: Ethan says he endured years of abuse at a prestigious boarding school. The legal process is a new type of trauma

image.altText: A screen shot from a website streaming Winki Pop surf beach.

props.synopsis: There are cameras right along Australia's east coast providing a glimpse into the day's surf conditions, but some locals on Victoria's Surf Coast believe a recent addition at a surf break near Bells Beach marks a "violation" of the area's values.

title.children: It's a simple shot of rolling waves, but the camera that filmed it is in the centre of a political storm

image.altText: A man stands in front of the bright sun.

props.synopsis: Sydney's ongoing heatwave has resulted in suburbs across the city's west and south-west swelter through their hottest start to the summer on record.

title.children: Hottest start to the summer on record for parts of Sydney

image.altText: Sky over town of Bright, Victoria with meteors in sky

props.synopsis: Celebrate the end of the year with some fireworks of the celestial kind — this year's Geminid meteor shower could be the best Australia has seen.

title.children: 'One of the best displays ever': Why this week's Geminid meteor shower has skywatchers excited

image.altText: A woman walks past a store of Ukraine's telecommunications company Kyivstar.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's biggest mobile network operator, Kyivstar, has 24.3 million mobile subscribers — more than half of Ukraine's population — as well as over 1.1 million home internet subscribers.

title.children: Massive cyber attack leaves more than half of Ukraine to suffer through phone outage

image.altText: Prospective leaders running in Indonesia's election attend a debate.

props.synopsis: They went head-to-head in a debate broadcast across Indonesian television screens as they bid to succeed President Joko Widodo in a vote where nearly 205 million people are eligible to cast their ballot.

title.children: Indonesia presidential candidates talk corruption and Papua in first debate

image.altText: NSW Ambulance paramedics are seen at Royal Prince Alfred Hospital in Sydney

props.synopsis: About a third of NSW paramedics are holding out on renewing their professional registration, in a threat the Industrial Relations Commission heard "poses a significant risk to the safety of the public".

title.children: NSW paramedics' pay dispute has led to a threat that poses a 'significant risk to safety'. How did it get to this?

image.altText: A pic and white plume of smoke can be seen in a vast grass paddock

props.synopsis: The arrival of an explosives manufacturer next to a bushfire-prone paddock in Bogan Gate has locals on edge, as regulators and industry debate how to store ammonium nitrate safely.

title.children: Bogan Gate Explosive Reserve concerns nearby residents

image.altText: Man seen from behind with grey hair and blue shirt. He faces towards a vast expanse of blurred ocean.

props.synopsis: Retirement can bring unexpected challenges from a lack of sense of purpose and missing social network. But these experts say it's a phase of life that has much to offer — if you're prepared.

title.children: Jim thought retirement would be bliss. Instead his drinking spiked and his mental health declined

image.altText: Nathaniel, Gareth and Stacey Train graphic black and white with aerial view of their property behind

props.synopsis: The two adult children of those responsible for the Wieambilla shooting publicly express their deep regret for the suffering caused by their parents one year ago today.

title.children: 'We are truly sorry for the suffering our parents have caused' say Train children

image.altText: Brittany Higgins walks with her partner.

props.synopsis: Sky News complies with Justice Michael Lee's order to hand over an alleged recording between lawyer Leon Zwier and David Sharaz that purportedly took place during Brittany Higgins's testimony.

title.children: Sky News produces alleged secret recording of conversation between Brittany Higgins's lawyer and fiance

image.altText: A map showing a cyclone off the north-east coast of Australia.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Jasper is expected to cross the Queensland coast within 24 hours, but there is a "cone of uncertainty" as to where it will make landfall, the Bureau of Meteorology says.

title.children: What is controlling Tropical Cyclone Jasper's path?

image.altText: A woman and a man lean over a bench and speak to another woman while a man makes a speech in the background

props.synopsis: There have been some frenzied days in Tasmania's parliament, but this was peak chaos — parliament recalled from summer break to suspend a judge charged with assault and abuse, only for the Liberal government to decide the best option was to do nothing, writes Adam Langenberg.

title.children: Tasmanian parliament suspends itself instead of judge charged with assault

image.altText: Caroline Polachek looks up, wearing a dark blue off the shoulder dress in an orange room with unknown objects

props.synopsis: The art-pop wonder delivered both nostalgic and future-focused pop in one stunning package, with a little help from a 90s pop icon.

title.children: Who is Caroline Polachek? And why is her album the best of 2023?

image.altText: Sydney Mardi Gras

props.synopsis: Members of the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras have voted to cancel a deal with police to conduct "public decency inspections" on those marching in the annual pride parade.

title.children: Mardi Gras members vote to cancel police 'decency checks' at parade

image.altText: Two dingoes on the beach at Fraser Island, with one wearing a GPS tracking collar.

props.synopsis: Two children are attacked by dingoes in a short space of time on K'gari with an investigation launched by wildlife officers.

title.children: Dingoes attack two children on K'gari, prompting rangers to investigate

image.altText: Head shot of a caucasian man in a suit, attending a forum, with white facial stubble

props.synopsis: A lawyer defends the decision by former foreign affairs minister Marise Payne to impose sanctions on Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska.

title.children: Lawyer says Russian billionaire banned from Australia is a 'personal friend' of Vladimir Putin

image.altText: A woman with black hair in a black dress sits behind a desk with a micorphone

props.synopsis: Mothers have cried while telling a NSW inquiry into birth trauma of being ignored and mistreated by hospital staff.

title.children: Mum says country hospital staff made no attempt to gain consent during birthing
